gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਭ ਨਿਸੁੰਭ ਹਨਿਓ ਸੁਨਿ ਕੈ ਬਰ ਬੀਰਨ ਕੇ ਚਿਤ ਛੋਭ ਸਮਾੲਿਓ ||
transliteration: Sounbh Nisounbh Hanio Soun(i) Kai Bar Booran Ke Chit Chhodhh Samaaio||
translation: When Sumbh heard about the death of Nisumbh, the anger of that mighty warrior knew no bounds.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਜ ਚੜਿਓ ਗਜ ਬਾਜ ਸਮਾਜ ਕੈ ਦਾਨਵ ਪੁੰਜ ਲੀੲੇ ਰਨ ਅਾੲਿਓ ||
transliteration: Saaj Chadio Gad Baaj Samaaj Kai Daanav Pounj Looe Ran Aaio||
translation: Filled with great fury, he bedecked all the paraphernalia of elephants and horses, and taking the divisions of his army, he entered the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਮ ਭੲਿਅਾਨਕ ਲੋਥ ਪਰੀ ਲਖਿ ਸ੍ਰੳੁਨ ਸਮੂਹ ਮਹਾਂ ਬਿਸਮਾੲਿਓ ||
transliteration: Bhoom Bhaiaanak Loth Daroo Lakh(i) Sraoun Samoond Mahaan Bismaaio||
translation: In that frightening field, seeing the corpses and the amassed blood, he was greatly astonished.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਨਹੁ ਸਾਰਸੁਤੀ ੳੁਮਡੀ ਜਲ ਸਾਗਰ ਕੇ ਮਿਲਿਬੇ ਕਹੁ ਧਾੲਿਓ ||੨੦੫||
transliteration: Maanoh Saarsoutoo Oumdoo Jal Saagad Ke Milibe Kahu Dhaaio||205||
translation: It seemed that the surging Saraswati is running to meet the ocean.205.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਡਿ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡਿ ਸੁ ਕੇਹਰਿ ਕਾਲਕਾ ਅੳੁ ਸਕਤੀ ਮਿਲਿ ਜੁੱਧ ਕਰਿਓ ਹੈ ||
transliteration: Channd(i) Prachanndd(i) Su Kehar(i) Kaalkaa Au Saktoo Mil(i) Juddh Kario Hai||
translation: The fierce Chandi, Lion Kalika other powers have waged a violent war together.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਨਵ ਸੈਨ ਹਤੀ ੲਿਨਹੂੰ ਸਭ ੲਿੳੁ ਕਹਿ ਕੈ ਮਨ ਕੋਪ ਭਰਿਓ ਹੈ ||
transliteration: Daanav Sain Hatoo Inhoon Sabh Io Kah(i) Kai Man Kop Bhario Hai||
translation: “They have killed all the army of the demons,” saying this the mind of Sumbh was filled with rage.

gurmukhi: ਬੰਧ ਕਬੰਧ ਪਰਿਓ ਅਵਲੋਕ ਕੈ ਸੋਕ ਕੈ ਪਾੲਿਨ ਅਾਗੈ ਧਰਿਓ ਹੈ ||
transliteration: Bandh Kabandh Pario Avlok Kais Ok Kai Paain Aagad Dhario Hai||
translation: Seeing the trunk of the body of his brother on one side, and in deep sorrow he could not move a step forward.

gurmukhi: ਧਾੲਿ ਸਕਿਓ ਨ ਭੲਿਓ ਭੲਿ ਭੀਤਹ ਚੀਤਹ ਮਾਨਹੁ ਲੰਗ ਪਰਿਓ ਹੈ ||੨੦੬||
transliteration: Dhaae Sakio Na Bhaio Bhae Bhootah Chootah Maanoh Lan Pario Hai||206||
translation: He was so much frightened that he could not speedily go forward; it seemed that the leopard had become lame.206.

gurmukhi: ਫੇਰਿ ਕਹਿਓ ਦਲ ਕੋ ਜਬ ਸੁੰਭ ਸੁ ਮਾਨਿ ਚਲੇ ਤਬ ਦੈਤ ਘਨੇ ||
transliteration: Pher(i) Kahio Dal Ko Jab Sounbh Su Maan(i) Chale Tab Dait Ghane||
translation: When Sumbh commanded his army, many demons marched forward, obeying the orders.

gurmukhi: ਗਜ ਰਾਜ ਸੁ ਬਾਜਨ ਕੇ ਅਸਵਾਰ ਰਥੀ ਰਥੁ ਪਾੲਿਕ ਕੳੁਨ ਗਨੇ ||
transliteration: Gad Raaj Su Baajan Ke Asvaar Rathoo Rath(u) Paaik Kaoun Gade||
translation: Who could count the riders of great elephants and horses, the chariots, warriors on chariots and warriors on foot?

gurmukhi: ਤਹਾਂ ਘੇਰ ਲੲੀ ਚਹੂੰ ਓਰ ਤੇ ਚੰਡ ਮਹਾਂ ਤਿਹ ਕੇ ਤਨ ਦੀਹ ਬਨੇ ||
transliteration: Tahaan Gher Laoo Chahoon Or Te Channd Mahaan Tih Ke Tan Dooh Bane||
translation: They, of very huge bodies, besieged Chandi from all the four sides.

gurmukhi: ਮਨੋ ਭਾਨ ਕੋ ਛਾੲਿ ਲੲਿਓ ੳੁਮਡੇ ਘਨ ਘੋਰ ਘਮੰਡ ਘਟਾ ਨਿਸ ਨੇ ||੨੦੭||
transliteration: Mano Bhaan Ko Chhaad Laio Oumde Ghan Ghor Ghamannd Ghataa Nis Ne||207||
translation: It seemed that the overflowing proud and thundering dark clouds have enshrouded the sun.207.
